abstract: Prosecutors argued for a second day in court that four employees from the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto accepted millions of dollars in bribes and stole commercial secrets from Chinese companies, but the closed nature of the trial made it hard to assess the evidence in the high-profile case.
snippet: Prosecutors argued for a second day in court that four employees from the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto accepted millions of dollars in bribes and stole commercial secrets from Chinese companies, but the closed nature of the trial made...
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors argued for a second day in court that four employees from the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto accepted millions of dollars in bribes and stole commercial secrets from Chinese companies, but the closed nature of the trial made it difficult to assess the evidence they presented in the high-profile case, The New York Times’s David Barboza writes.

headline.main: At Rio Tinto Trial in China, Door Closes Tighter

abstract: BG Group said it had agreed to supply China National Offshore Oil Corp., or Cnooc, 3.6 million tons of Australian liquefied natural gas annually for the next 20 years, in a deal one analyst estimated to be worth up to $70 billion, while selling the state-run company a small stake in BG’s coal bed gas assets.
snippet: BG Group said it had agreed to supply China National Offshore Oil Corp., or Cnooc, 3.6 million tons of Australian liquefied natural gas annually for the next 20 years, in a deal one analyst estimated to be worth up to $70 billion, while selling th...
lead_paragraph: BG Group said Wednesday that it agreed to supply China National Offshore Oil Corp., or Cnooc, 3.6 million tons of liquefied natural gas annually for the next 20 years, in a deal one analyst estimated to be worth up to $70 billion, while selling the state-run company a small stake in BG’s Australian coal bed gas assets.

headline.main: BG Group and Cnooc Sign $70 Billion Gas Deal
